org.typemeta.funcj.control

Interface State<S,A>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - the state type
    A - the result type
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface State<S,A>
    State monad.

    Each State instance is a state processor that takes a state of type S, and produces a new state and a result of type A. The state processor is represented by the runState(Object) SAM.

    Note, this State type uses the Trampoline monad to translate a recursive evaluation model into an iterative one, thereby avoiding the issue of StackOverflowErrors.

      Combine a State that wraps a function with a State that wraps a value, to yield a State that wraps the result of applying the function to the value.

        static <S,A,B> State<S,IList<B>> traverse(IList<A> lt,
                                          Functions.F<A,State<S,B>> f)
        Standard applicative traversal.

        Equivalent to 

        sequence(lt.map(f))
        .
        Type Parameters:
        S - the state type
        A - type of list elements
        B - the state result type
        Parameters:
        lt - list of values
        f - function to be applied to each value in the list
        Returns:

      • sequence

        static <S,A> State<S,IList<A>> sequence(IList<? extends State<S,A>> lsa)
        Standard applicative sequencing.

        Translate a IList of State into a State of an IList, by composing each consecutive State using the apply(State) method.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the state type
        A - the result type of the States in the list
        Parameters:
        lsa - the list of State values
        Returns:
        a State which wraps an IList of values

        Variation of sequence(IList) for Stream.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the state type
        T - the result type of the States in the stream
        Parameters:
        sst - the stream of State values
        Returns:
        a State which wraps an Stream of values

      • runState

        Trampoline<Tuple2<S,A>> runState(S state)
        The state processor.

        This the SAM that implementations implement, typically via a lambda, runState is essentially a function that can be applied to a state S to yield a new state and a result.

        Parameters:
        state - the input state.
        Returns:
        the new state and a result

        Parameters:
        f - the function to be mapped
        Returns:
        the new State

      • apply

        default <B> State<S,B> apply(State<S,Functions.F<A,B>> sf)
        Combine a State that wraps a function with a State that wraps a value, to yield a State that wraps the result of applying the function to the value. Applicative apply operation (with args reversed).
        Type Parameters:
        B - the State that wraps a value
        Parameters:
        sf - the State that wraps a function
        Returns:
        a State that wraps the result of applying the function to the value

      • flatMap

        default <B> State<S,B> flatMap(Functions.F<A,State<S,B>> f)
        FlatMap a function over the state.

        Compose a State with a function that yields another a State, to form a new a State. A.k.a. monadic bind operation.

        Type Parameters:
        B - result value type
        Parameters:
        f - the function that yields a State
        Returns:
        a State
